ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY

Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Some people have periods lasting several days or longer when they feel much more excited and faull of energy than usual. They talk a lot. They are very restless or unable to sit still and they sometimes do things that are unusual for them, such as driving too fast or spending too much money. Have you ever had a period like this that lasted several days or longer?
Have you ever had a period lasting several days or longer when most of the time you were so irritable or grouchy that you either started arguments, shouted at people, or hit people?

People who have episodes like this often have changes in their thinking and behavior at the same time, like being more talkative, needing very little sleep, being very restless, going on buying sprees, and behaving in ways they would normally think are inappropriate. Did you ever have any of these changes during your episodes of being (excited and full of energy/very irritable or grouchy)?
Were you so irritable that you either started arguments, shouted at people, or hit people?
Did you become so restless or fidgety that you paced up and down or couldn't stand still?
Did you do anything else that wasn't usual for you: like talking about things you would normally keep private, or acting in ways that you'd usually find embarrassing?
Did you try to do things that were impossible to do, like taking on large amounts of work?
Did you constantly keep changing your plans or activities?
Did you find it hard to keep your mind on what you were doing?
Did your thoughts seem to jump from one thing to another or race through your head so fast you couldn't keep track of them?
Did you sleep far less than usual and still not get tired or sleepy?
Did you spend so much more money than usual that it caused you to have financial trouble?
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data

Notes: 0=Never; 1=Less than once a month; 2=Once a month; 3=A few times a month; 4=A few times a week; 5=Almost every day; -98=DON‘’T KNOW; -97=REFUSED; -8=DON‘’T KNOW; -7=REFUSED; -5=Presented, not answered

ElementDescription: does participant have post-traumatic stress disorder? 0 = no; 1 = yes
does participant have post-traumatic stress disorder? 0 = no; 1 = yes
Have you ever been admitted to the hospital for a general medical condition? (Not including pregnancy or mental illness.)
How many previous hospitalizations have you had? Please do not include hospitalizations for pregnancy or mental illness.
Please think of the two-week period during the past twelve months when you had the most complete loss of interest in things. Did you feel more tired out or low on energy than is usual for you?

Please think of the two-week period during the past twelve months when you had the most complete loss of interest in things. During these two weeks, did you gain or lose weight without trying, or did you stay about the same?
Please think of the two-week period during the past twelve months when you had the most complete loss of interest in things. About how much did your weight change during these two weeks, in pounds?

Please think of the two-week period during the past twelve months when you had the most complete loss of interest in things. Did you have more trouble falling asleep than you usually do during those two weeks?
If you had more trouble falling asleep than you usually do during those two weeks, did that happen every night, nearly every night, or less often?

Please think of the two-week period during the past twelve months when you had the most complete loss of interest in things. During those two weeks, did you have a lot more trouble concentrating than usual?

Please think of the two-week period during the past twelve months when you had the most complete loss of interest in things. People sometimes feel down on themselves, no good, or worthless; during that two week period, did you feel this way?

Please think of the two-week period during the past twelve months when you had the most complete loss of interest in things. Did you think a lot about death - either your own, someone else's or death in general - during those two weeks?
During the past twelve months, has there ever been a time when you felt sad, blue, or depressed for two or more weeks in a row?
Please think of the two-week period during the past twelve months when these feelings were worst. During that time, did the feelings of being sad, blue, or depressed usually last:
Notes: 1=All day long; 2=Most of the day; 3=About half of the day; 4=Less than half the day

ElementDescription: Please think of the two-week period during the past twelve months when these feelings were worst. During those two weeks, did you feel this way:

Please think of the two-week period during the past twelve months when these feelings were worst. During those two weeks, did you lose interest in most things like hobbies, work, or activities that usually give you pleasure?

Please think of the two-week period during the past twelve months when these feelings were worst. During the past twelve months, has there ever been a time lasting two weeks or more when you lost interest in most things like hobbies, work or activities that usually give you pleasure?
Please think of the two-week period during the past twelve months when you had the most complete loss of interest in things. During that two-week period, did the loss of interest usually last:
Notes: 1=All day long; 2=Most of the day; 3=About half of the day; 4=Less than half the day

ElementDescription: Please think of the two-week period during the past twelve months when you had the most complete loss of interest in things. Did you feel this way every day, almost every day, or less often during the two weeks?
